comments.body:
It looks like this can be `noarch: python`

https://conda-forge.org/docs/maintainer/knowledge_base.html#noarch-python

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"

requirements:

comments.body: I think `host` can just contain `pip`, `python` and `pytest-runner`

Include a comment above the `license_file` line containing the following link as a reminder to check if the license file is included in a future release of the source distribution:

https://github.com/benedekrozemberczki/karateclub/pull/39

Something like:

```
   # Check status of https://github.com/benedekrozemberczki/karateclub/pull/39 for inclusion of license file in source distribtion
   license_file: LICENSE.txt
   ...
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +52,56 @@  license: GPL-3.0-only
  # Check status of https://github.com/benedekrozemberczki/karateclub/pull/39 for inclusion of license file in source distribtion
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: "A general purpose library for community detection, network embedding, and graph mining research."
  doc_url: "https://karateclub.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html"
